H0.text: Mass is the characteristic of an element that determines its placement in the periodic table.

H1.text: Size determines an element's placement in the periodic table.

H2.text: The number of neutrons is the characteristic of an element that determines its placement in the periodic table.

H3.text: The number of protons is the characteristic of an element that determines its placement in the periodic table.

A4.text: The atomic number (Z) of a chemical element is the charge number of its atomic nucleus. For ordinary nuclei composed of protons and neutrons, this is equal to the proton number (np)

A5.text: A simple numbering based on atomic weight position was never entirely satisfactory
